name: ASRA
description:
Video game graduation project made for ESA Saint-Luc Brussels 

ASRA is a puzzle game,  played with a virtual controller in the shape of a tower made up of several rotating cylinders. The goal is to guide a young woman through the different levels of a tower and to help her bring the night back into the sky. You can create shadow paths with the controller, which can interact and rotate elements of the game. 

Duration of the game : about 15min 

Controls : ZQSD or directional arrows, spacebar

If you can't solve a level, you can skip the level by pressing Enter

The game was made for windows, there is a mac version but there is no guarantee that it is compatible with your device. Be careful to have the correct graphics card selected in Windows or Mac befaure launching the game. You must have a decent graphic card to run the game correctly. 

Production : Lucas Delmas - Lou Chédeville - Elisa De Greve

Programmation & Sound Design - Lucas Delmas

Level Design & Environement - Lou Chédeville

3D & FX - Lou Chédeville and Lucas Delmas

Character and 2D illustrations - Elisa De Greve

Original Soundtrack by Antoine Jorissen

June 2020
